data.title: Books
data.description: Apps that provide extensive interactivity for content that is traditionally offered in printed form. If youâ€™re planning a more traditional reading experience, you may want to look at publishing an iBook instead.
data.example: stories, comics, eReaders, coffee table books, graphic novels

data.title: Business
data.description: Apps that assist with running a business or provide a means to collaborate, edit, or share content.
data.example: document management, PDFs, scanning, file viewing, file editing, VoIP telephony, dictation, remote desktop, job search resources, customer resource management, collaboration, enterprise resource planning, point of sale

data.title: Developer Tools
data.description: Apps that provide tools for app development, management, and distribution.
data.example: coding, testing, debugging, workflow management, text and code editing

data.title: Education
data.description: Apps that provide an interactive learning experience on a specific skill or subject.
data.example: arithmetic, alphabet, writing, early learning and special education, solar system, vocabulary, colors, language learning, standardized test prep, geography, school portals, pet training, astronomy, crafts

data.title: Entertainment
data.description: Apps that are interactive and designed to entertain and inform the user, and which contain audio, visual, or other content.
data.example: television, movies, second screens, fan clubs, theatre, ringtones, voice manipulation, ticketing services, art creation
